title: How to Move Multiple Files Into a New Folder on a Mac

steps.title: Launch Finder and navigate to the files you want to move into a new folder.
steps.content: Launch Finder and navigate to the files you want to move into a new folder.

steps.title: Select the files.
steps.content: Select the files. You can hold “shift” and click the first and last file to select a group of files, or hold “command” and click to select individual files. Alternatively, press “command + A” to select all files.

steps.title: Right click any of the select files.
steps.content: Right click any of the select files.

steps.title: Select “New Folder with Selection” from the context menu.
steps.content: Select “New Folder with Selection” from the context menu.

steps.title: All selected files will be moved in the created folder.
steps.content: All selected files will be moved in the created folder.
